thread.title: Halloween happenings in the Brockport area
thread.title_full: Halloween happenings in the Brockport area

author: Caurie Putnam - Brockport, ROC
title: Halloween happenings in the Brockport area
text:
by Caurie Putnam Brockport is the place to be for Halloween happenings.
Here is a list of events for the 2015 Halloween festivities:
School of Screams, Hamlin
The Town of Hamlin's town hall and grounds, 1658 Lake Road, Hamlin, will be haunted for the annual School of Screams 2015 on Friday, October 23 and Saturday, October 24 from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m.
Tickets are $6 pp and partial proceeds benefit Hamlin's Life Solutions, Inc.
The School of Screams, sponsored by Hamlin Recreation, is not recommended for children under 10 years old. Flashing lights will be used inside.
Wegmans Brockport Halloween Part y
Wegmans Brockport, 6660 4th Section Rd, Brockport, will host a Halloween Party on Tuesday, October 27 from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. The event is free. Children 12 and under with their parents are welcome. Sweden Clarkson Recreation Center's Community Halloween Party On Thursday, October 29 from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. the Sweden Clarkson Recreation Center will host their 12th annual Community Halloween Party – sponsored by Brockport Wegmans. The recreation center is located at 4927 Lake Road South, Brockport. This event is open to children in grades 4 and under and their parents/caregivers. There will be a costume contest at 7:15 p.m. Other highlights are a scary haunted house, a not-scary "haunted" toddler gym, face painting, candy and more.
Midnight Madness, Village of Brockport
On Friday, October 30 the Brockport Merchants Association and College at Brockport's Physical Education Department will host the annual Midnight Madness event.
The festivities start at 6:30 p.m. with a costume parade and trick-or-treating through the shopping district (look for the balloons and lineup at the corner of Market Street and Main Street).
If you have never attended this event it is adorable and so much fun for the kids. The parade participants trick-or-treat at participating merchants.
Some of the merchants give out candy and others give out treats related to their business – like comic books or crayons.
Many village stores stay open until Midnight with special sales.
There will be a haunted house at the fire hall (38 Market Street) after the parade.
The event's Facebook page is here
